createV3Cert

public java.security.cert.X509Certificate createV3Cert(RSAPublicKey pubKey,
                                                       RSAPrivateKey caPrivKey,
                                                       java.math.BigInteger serial,
                                                       java.util.Date notBefore,
                                                       java.util.Date notAfter,
                                                       java.security.cert.X509Certificate caCert,
                                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> certificateInformationMap,
                                                       java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> keyUsageList,
                                                       java.lang.String certType)
                                                throws CryptoUtilsException,
                                                       CryptoUtilsX509ExtensionException
Description copied from interface: IX509Utils
Create X509 v3 Certificate for RSA Keys using SHA1withRSA algorithm as signing algorithm

Specified by:
createV3Cert in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
pubKey - Public Key to be certified
caPrivKey - PrivateKey of the signer CA
serial - Serial Number for the certificate
notBefore - Not Before Validity date
notAfter - Not After Validity date
caCert - CA PublicKey Certificate
certificateInformationMap - Map filled out with the certificate information using the Field key ( CertificateInformationKeys Supported Keys) and the field value
keyUsageList - List of Key Usages, see supported keyUsages at X509UtilsDictionary, i.e. X509UtilsDictionary.X509_KEYUSAGE_DECIPHER_ONLY
certType - Certificate type, see supported types at X509UtilsDictionary, i.e. X509UtilsDictionary.CERTIFICATE_TYPE_ROOT_CA
Returns:
A new signed X509 Public key certificate
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - If something goes wrong
CryptoUtilsX509ExtensionException - If something was not OK with the X509 Certificate extension verification, for example: DEVICE_ID is missing in the certificateInformationMap or If the CA can't issue Certificates according its KeyUsage certificate extension
See Also:
CertificateInformationKeys

createV3Cert

public java.security.cert.X509Certificate createV3Cert(ECPublicKey pubKey,
                                                       ECPrivateKey privKey,
                                                       java.math.BigInteger serial,
                                                       java.util.Date notBefore,
                                                       java.util.Date notAfter,
                                                       java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> certificateInformationMap,
                                                       java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> keyUsageList,
                                                       java.lang.String certType)
                                                throws CryptoUtilsException,
                                                       CryptoUtilsX509ExtensionException
Description copied from interface: IX509Utils
Create self-signed X509 v3 Certificate for EC Keys using SHA1withECDSA as signing algorithm

Specified by:
createV3Cert in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
pubKey - Public Key to be certified
serial - Serial Number for the certificate
notBefore - Not Before Validity date
notAfter - Not After Validity date
certificateInformationMap - Map filled out with the certificate information using the Field key ( CertificateInformationKeys Supported Keys) and the field value
keyUsageList - List of Key Usages, see supported keyUsages at X509UtilsDictionary, i.e. X509UtilsDictionary.X509_KEYUSAGE_DECIPHER_ONLY
certType - Certificate type, see supported types at X509UtilsDictionary, i.e. X509UtilsDictionary.CERTIFICATE_TYPE_ROOT_CA
Returns:
A new signed X509 Public key certificate
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - If something goes wrong
CryptoUtilsX509ExtensionException - If something was not OK with the X509 Certificate extension verification, for example: DEVICE_ID is missing in the certificateInformationMap or If the CA can't issue Certificates according its KeyUsage certificate extension

createCRL

public java.security.cert.X509CRL createCRL(RSAKeyPair issuerKeyPair,
                                            java.security.cert.X509Certificate issuerCertificate,
                                            java.util.List<X509CRLRevokedCertificateEntry> revokedCertificates,
                                            java.util.Date nextUpdate,
                                            java.math.BigInteger crlNumber)
                                     throws CryptoUtilsException,
                                            CryptoUtilsX509ExtensionException
Description copied from interface: IX509Utils
Creates a new X509 V2 Certificate Revocation List (CRL) signed using SHA256withRSAEncryption

Specified by:
createCRL in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
issuerKeyPair - RSA Key Pair of the issuer of the CRL, will be used for sign the CRL
issuerCertificate - X509Certificate of the issuer of the CRL
revokedCertificates - List of the revoked certificates to be added in the CRL
nextUpdate - Next update for the CRL
crlNumber - The CRL number is a non-critical CRL extension that conveys a monotonically increasing sequence number for a given CRL scope and CRL issuer
Returns:
a new CRL signed using SHA256withRSAEncryption with dated at the current date
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException
CryptoUtilsX509ExtensionException - If the CA can't issue CRL according its KeyUsage certificate extension

createCRL

public java.security.cert.X509CRL createCRL(RSAKeyPair issuerKeyPair,
                                            java.security.cert.X509Certificate issuerCertificate,
                                            java.util.List<X509CRLRevokedCertificateEntry> revokedCertificates,
                                            java.util.Date nextUpdate,
                                            java.math.BigInteger crlNumber,
                                            java.lang.String algorithm)
                                     throws CryptoUtilsException,
                                            CryptoUtilsX509ExtensionException
Description copied from interface: IX509Utils

createCRL in interface IX509Utils

nextUpdate - Next update for the CRL
crlNumber - The CRL number is a non-critical CRL extension that conveys a monotonically increasing sequence number for a given CRL scope and CRL issuer
algorithm - Selected algorithm to perform the sign of the CRL
Returns:
a new CRL signed using SHA256withRSAEncryption with dated at the current date
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException
CryptoUtilsX509ExtensionException - If the CA can't issue CRL according its KeyUsage certificate extension

Load a X509 CRL using an specific encoding from file

Specified by:
loadCRL in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
fileName - Full path and name of the file containing the x509 CRL
encoding - Encoding of the CRL, could be DER or PEM
Returns:
X509 CRL contained in the file
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - If the CRL could not be loaded, because wrong encoding selected or the file does not contain a valid X509 CRL

loadCRL

public java.security.cert.X509CRL loadCRL(java.lang.String fileName)
                                   throws CryptoUtilsException
Description copied from interface: IX509Utils
Load a X509 CRL, this function tries both supported encoding types, so it could be a bit slower than the function in which the encoded is selected

Specified by:
loadCRL in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
fileName - Full path and name of the file containing the x509 CRL
Returns:
X509 CRL contained in the file
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - If the CRL could not be loaded, because file does not contain a valid X509 CRL

verifyCertificate

public java.lang.Integer verifyCertificate(java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert,
                                           java.security.cert.X509Certificate cacert,
                                           java.security.cert.X509CRL crl)
                                    throws CryptoUtilsException
Description copied from interface: IX509Utils
Verify the status of a certificate

Specified by:
verifyCertificate in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
cert - Certificate to be verified
cacert - CA certificate, for verify the certificate signature
crl - Certificate Revocation List to with the certificate should be compared
Returns:
An integer representing the certificate status, see possible status as static attributes of X509UtilsDictionary, i.e, X509UtilsDictionary.X509_CERTIFICATE_STATUS_XXXXXX
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - if something is wrong with the certificate encoding or content

verifyCRL

public java.lang.Integer verifyCRL(java.security.cert.X509CRL crl,
                                   java.security.cert.X509Certificate cacert)
                            throws CryptoUtilsException
Description copied from interface: IX509Utils
Verifies if the CRL is valid using its issuers certificate

Specified by:
verifyCRL in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
crl - Certificate Revocation List (CRL) to be verified
cacert - Certificate of the CA that issues the CRL
Returns:
An integer representing the CRL status, see possible status as static attributes of X509UtilsDictionary, i.e, X509UtilsDictionary.X509_CRL_STATUS_XXXXXX
Throws:
CryptoUtilsException - if the CRL is not a valid X509 Certificate Revocation List

getAuthorityKeyIdentifier

Description copied from interface: IX509Utils
Gets the Certificate Authority Key Identifier from a X509 Certificate

Specified by:
getAuthorityKeyIdentifier in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
cert - X509 certificate that contains the authorityKeyIdentifier extension
Returns:
a byte array representing the key identifier, or null if the extension is not present in the certificate

getKeyUsageList

public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getKeyUsageList(java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert)
Description copied from interface: IX509Utils
Gets the list of key usage saved in the X509 Certificate

Specified by:
getKeyUsageList in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
cert - X509 certificate that contains the keyUsage extension
Returns:
List of Key Usages, see supported keyUsages values at X509UtilsDictionary, i.e. X509UtilsDictionary.X509_KEYUSAGE_DECIPHER_ONLY, or null if the extension is not present in the certificate

getExtensionCertificateType

public java.lang.String getExtensionCertificateType(java.security.cert.X509Certificate cert,
                                                    java.lang.String language)
Description copied from interface: IX509Utils
Get the certificate type, in base of the basicConstrain certificate extension

Specified by:
getExtensionCertificateType in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
cert - X509 certificate that contains the basicConstrains extension
language - ISO Language code to be used for getting the String equivalence
Returns:
Certificate type, see supported types at X509UtilsDictionary, i.e. X509UtilsDictionary.CERTIFICATE_TYPE_ROOT_CA, or null if the extension is not present in the certificate

Get the certificate information map from a X509 Certificate

Specified by:
getCertificateInformationMap in interface IX509Utils
Parameters:
cert - X509 certificate that contains the basicConstrains extension
Returns:
Map filled out with the certificate information using the Field key ( CertificateInformationKeys Supported Keys) and the field value
